source: %matplotlib inline
import pandas as pd

text/html:
<style>body {
    margin: 0;
    font-family: Helvetica;
}
table.dataframe {
    border-collapse: collapse;
    border: none;
}
table.dataframe tr {
    border: none;
}
table.dataframe td, table.dataframe th {
    margin: 0;
    border: 1px solid white;
    padding-left: 0.25em;
    padding-right: 0.25em;
}
table.dataframe th:not(:empty) {
    background-color: #fec;
    text-align: left;
    font-weight: normal;
}
table.dataframe tr:nth-child(2) th:empty {
    border-left: none;
    border-right: 1px dashed #888;
}
table.dataframe td {
    border: 2px solid #ccf;
    background-color: #f4f4ff;
}
h3 {
    color: white;
    background-color: black;
    padding: 0.5em;
}
</style>

source:
from IPython.core.display import HTML
css = open('style-table.css').read() + open('style-notebook.css').read()
HTML('<style>{}</style>'.format(css))
df_titles = pd.DataFrame.from_csv('data/titles.csv', index_col=None)
df_cast = pd.DataFrame.from_csv('data/cast.csv', index_col=None)
### Using groupby(), plot the number of films that have been released each decade in the history of cinema.
df_titles.groupby(df_titles.year // 10*10).size().plot(kind='bar')
### Use groupby() to plot the number of "Hamlet" films made each decade.
df_titles[df_titles.title == "Hamlet"].groupby(df_titles.year // 10*10).size().plot(kind='bar')
### How many leading (n=1) roles were available to actors, and how many to actresses, in each year of the 1950s?

text/plain:
year  type   
1950  actor      617
      actress    278
1951  actor      643
      actress    276
1952  actor      602
      actress    289
1953  actor      653
      actress    296
1954  actor      639
      actress    305
1955  actor      623
      actress    276
1956  actor      635
      actress    297
1957  actor      722
      actress    299
1958  actor      707
      actress    290
1959  actor      701
      actress    311
dtype: int64

source:
cast = df_cast[df_cast.year // 10 == 195]
cast = cast[cast.n==1].groupby(['year','type']).size()
cast.head(20)
### In the 1950s decade taken as a whole, how many total roles were available to actors, and how many to actresses, for each "n" number 1 through 5?

text/plain:
n    type   
1.0  actor      6542
     actress    2917
2.0  actor      4498
     actress    4511
3.0  actor      5520
     actress    3109
4.0  actor      5522
     actress    2817
5.0  actor      5547
     actress    2513
dtype: int64

source: cast = df_cast[df_cast.year // 10 == 195]
cast[cast.n < 6].groupby(['n','type']).size()

source: cast = df_cast[df_cast.title.str.contains("Pink Panther ")]
### List, in order by year, each of the films in which Frank Oz has played more than 1 role.

text/plain:
title                                 year
An American Werewolf in London        1981    2
Follow That Bird                      1985    3
Muppet Treasure Island                1996    4
Muppets from Space                    1999    4
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland  1999    3
The Dark Crystal                      1982    2
The Great Muppet Caper                1981    6
The Muppet Christmas Carol            1992    7
The Muppet Movie                      1979    8
The Muppets Take Manhattan            1984    7
dtype: int64

source:
cast = df_cast[df_cast.name == 'Frank Oz']
cast_grouped = cast.groupby(["title","year"]).size()
cast_grouped[cast_grouped > 1]
### List each of the characters that Frank Oz has portrayed at least twice.

text/plain:
character
Grover            2
Bert              3
Cookie Monster    3
Fozzie Bear       4
Sam the Eagle     5
Animal            6
Miss Piggy        6
Yoda              6
dtype: int64

source:
c = df_cast
c = c[c.name == 'Frank Oz']
g = c.groupby(['character']).size()
g[g > 1].sort_values()
